The disease is love.
Marriage is the cure.

I wonder how far I could throw you...

seriously. I want someone to propose to me with "Every Little Thing She Does Is Magic" playing in the background.

name: untilyouaresonude
text:
Anyone who was a fan of the short-lived Studio 60 is going to feel the pain in that song for the rest of their lives. Thanks to this comic, I might actually enjoy the song.

This is about the happiest Beef has ever been/might ever be. I love days like today.

name: apatfan
text: I've been seeing some Studio 60 episodes pop up on my DVR with "New" next to the title... IMDB seems to confirm it.. is it maybe not cancelled now?

name: greenideas
text: It's still cancelled. They're just airing the last few episodes that were already in the can. It'll be gone forever in a couple of weeks.

name: son_of_selleck
text: this makes me unfeasibly happy. I should really get away from the screen more often, and find my own molly who will basically abide me when my butt falls off.

I hate to do this but...

awwwwwwwwwwwww

name: fantomeciel
text: A new favorite. The alt-text takes it, though. I laughed so hard my dog gave me a strange look.

name: nathanielperson
text: The alt text made my day. Actually, I'm about to go to bed, so I guess it made my tomorrow.

name: odvo
text: I give it a five, but if there is no puke in tomorrow's strip, I'm coming back and giving it a three from another computer to retroactively change it to four.

name: andyetandyet
text: It's funny because I'm half awake too.  So speaking of computer based marriage proposals, will you marry me Karen?  I will accept Sting if it comes to that.  And I'll be as nice to you as you are to your cat.

name: sabalpalm
text: Thank you. I love you as much and maybe even more than my cat, you don't have to worry about Sting, and of course I will marry you, Skyler.  It's been a certainty ever since the days of The Contract.

name: bacter
text: wait. wait a damn minute. what in the hell just happened?

name: lukef
text:
I can't work out if that was some sort of joke or "Karen and Skyler" just got engaged?
Did cartoons gets inspire you to get married?

name: andyetandyet
text: Well, yes I did just ask her to marry me, yes she did agree to.  But it's not quite so dramatic, because this sort of thing has been in the works for a long time and it's not the biggest surprise in the world.  I said if R.B. Kazenzakis managed to formally do it then I would too.  We were more inspired by being in googley eyed love than cartoon cats, but call the announcement in honor of them?  So that's that.  We decided the actual ceremonies and certificates and tax breaks may have to wait for a little while because of some reasons, but us getting married is totally a thing that is happening.

name: zefiel
text: Awesome, for some reason I thought it was true from the first post of yours. So... it's the whole internet invited? Will there be cake?

name: lateadopter
text: Will female British cats squash the cake under their bottoms?

name: epicurus
text: Wow. That is fairly pimp. If you are going to propose and accept marriage on only one webcomic forum, Achewood is the correct choice.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Sir, we demand a picture of you two to know that this is not some great sham. Now, sir. Now.

name: bixschmix
text:
Keep us posted! We all feel involved in your coming nuptials, now.

(My feelings on this proposal are: Pro.)

name: onepapertiger
text: Wow. This is way in the manner of late but congratulations to you.

name: thedon
text: Oooooooooh Shiiiiiiiiit

name: kikimilks
text: um if true, totally awesome? ALSO, i was so happy and then i started choking at the alt text.  such a good way to start the morning!

text:
I love/hate the fact that your proposal and her acceptance of said proposal got lamed exactly one time, presumably by the same guy.

Some dude REALLY hates the idea of you two being happy.

(if you two are still around, how is the marriage going?)

name: professorriffs
text: I'm sure if you actually read and stuff, you will find that you are wrong and also incorrect.  There are plenty of complaints to be had, and also not every strip is rated a 5 (usually around a 3.5, it seems).  You're on a forum where fans post about a comic strip that they like.  If you're not expecting praise to be in a place like that, well....see me on Fuck You Friday.

name: professorriffs
text: oh yeah, and, this current story arc is the best one in a while, methinks, maybe that has something to do with it.  (p.s. dear people who make this thing, add an edit button, por favor)

sadly i have to agree with him here people do seem to kiss a lot of arse on here, but at least the fact that achewood is good is true(pif not little over stated)

awhhh. =)

name: lateadopter
text: I ran out of chubbies.  Literally, "You have given out enough Chubbies on this page, Friendly."  Where's my Acheworld Viagra?  Do I have to give out lames to get back my mojo?

name: lateadopter
text:
Okay, so I tried giving lames, but the system let me give only one before telling me to be nice for a change. I only gave out the one lame because my chubbies got cut off! (That's not as painful as it sounds.)

I guess there's combined limit, and the limit on either one is (combined limit - 1).

text: I can't read about Sting without thinking about his part in the Dune movie. Needless to say this strip brings up strange, strange mental pictures.

name: jackparsons
text: There was something called "Brimstone and Treacle" where Sting is maybe the devil. Clicked it off after 5 minutes for some reason.  Men hit their intellectual peak at 30, so don't be surprised when a hot hand grows cold when he ages.

name: boredom_man
text: I watched it through. SPOILERS: He's not the devil. It's not good. Jackparsons' male friends are all alcoholics.

name: srikamaraja
text: Those of us who do not appreciate Sting watch Dune to see him die. Looped. In perpetuity.

name: ariamaki
text: This causes Happy RB, which is weird to see-- nice, but weird.

name: coolbreeze3
text: This is exactly the way I want to be proposed to. :D

name: bourbonsamurai
text:
Made me tear up, even reading it for the second time.

I'm drunk this time, tho.

name: drskradley
text: This makes me happy every damn time.  Also, it makes me anxious to see Lyle puke so hard it makes a football go three feet, every time.

name: missbee
text: i missed this one before. :O roast beef is so cute

name: thegrayhoodie
text: apparently it means accepting John Mayer as well.  I don't think so, toots!

name: tekende
text: Your body is a wonderlaaaaaannnnd

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Is so happy.
Is so good.

name: nochmal
text: I sniffled enough in my eyes here to wonder why the cursor didn't move when I made my mouse do. (Answer: it was Molly's cursor, or rather Beef's, which Molly had positioned -- hell of confusing)

name: hcaz
text: WHY IS THIS RATED A FIVE? ROAST BEEF IS THE MAN.

name: hcaz
text:
Oh, no way. I fully fucked that up.

Bring on the Lames.

name: zapatos
text:
Woo! Go Cassandra!

I proposed by rolling over in bed, holding the ring, and being very much asleep.

name: lugosh
text: Nice half-beard! (I am sporting one of those myself as I type this)

name: zapatos
text: I would peek around corners, noone suspected a thing.

name: tbtabby
text: You cannot five this enough.

name: dwodles
text: This strip/arc should have the option of rating it no less than 10.

name: scura
text: i want to rate this one 5... again.

name: hazelfo
text: I love Beef's smile. It is so sincere.

name: ctaronno
text: Five! Five! A million times five!

name: likeiwassaying
text: this is my third time seeing this, and it is still the sweetest achewood strip possible. it carries all of the feel of achewood and is the culminating moment of beef finally Doing a Thing.

name: quantumcasaba
text: Can someone explain to me what Nick Hornby has to do with the title? I'm sorry if this question makes me an uncultured philistine, but I'm stumped other than the fact that I know he is an author.

name: likeiwassaying
text: I'm pretty sure it's a reference to High Fidelity where Laura likes bad music and Rob has to learn to accept that despite his indie cred bugging him.

name: biancasimone
text: Beef rules. Hands down. :)

name: mercuri0us
text:
Only time I've ever seen Beef smile like this:

. .
|
~

name: stashews
text: Laughs for alt-text. Many laughs.

name: thesmugelderly
text: This is the strip that made me truly realize the beauty of achewood

name: dartigen
text:
Very off-topic, but does anyone else keep getting a problem where they can't scroll or click anything on the page and have to refresh to fix it?
I'm using Firefox 3.6.10, and this is the only site I've had it happen.
